blocks.text: Let $I$ denote the moment of resistance of the internal forces
$e = \frac{I}{A}$, where $e$ is the eccentricity of the moment about NN

Hence, considering the strength of a little bending moment, it is necessary to know the moment of inertia of this section; knowing this and the bending moment, we can calculate the maximum skin stress.
Let us understand the importance of I in engineering formulae but let us do it in a different way: If a magnet is allowed to swing in a field, the time T of a complete oscillation is given by:

blocks.description: This formula relates the time period of oscillation T to the moment of inertia I, mass m, and magnetic field strength H.

blocks.text: Note that the choice of a cubical section is required; and it will be seen that no matter how much we increase the thickness.

The resultant inertia also depends on the position of the centroid and the angular velocity. There is a very important factor, I, which is dimensionless. For example, for a mass of 1 lb. swinging at the end of a meter.
The accurate velocity in the two cases were the same.
The reason for the presence of I in formulae concerning the energy of inertia must be better understood if the next Example is carefully studied.
